data: For use by ED Providers and Sexual Assault Nurse Examiners who are part of a designated program
For non-pregnant and pregnant adults, select ceFIXime and azithromycin
800 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
1 g, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
If penicillin and/or cephalosporin allergic, select azithromycin (concomitant anti-emetics recommended)
2 g, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
If macrolide allergic, and pregnant/breastfeeding, select ceFIXime and amoxicillin
800 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
500 mg, PO, once, drug form: cap, Take Home, Dispense qty: 21 doses or times
If macrolide allergic, but NOT PREGNANT, select ceFIXime and doxycycline
800 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
100 mg, PO, once, drug form: cap, Take Home, Dispense qty: 14 doses or times
If patient is allergic to Penicillin, macrolide and tetracycline, patient may require spectinomycin. Please consult BCCDC
Please contact BC Centre for Excellence in HIV/AIDS 1-888-511-6222, if uncertain about whether or not to initiate post-exposure prophylaxis
HIV Exposure Kit contains liamiVUDine 150mg, BID for 5 days, raltegravir 400 mg, BID for 5 days, tenofovir 300mg, qdaily for 5 days
1 mL, IM once, first dose: NOW
0.5 mL, IM once, first dose: NOW
0.5 mL, IM once, first dose: NOW
1.5 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
For physician use only. Sexual Assault Nurses to use NIA Acute Mild to Moderate Pain (Adult) Powerplan and obtain physician order for Hepatitis B Immune Globulin IM as needed
50 mg, PO, q6h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab
dose range: 325 to 975 mg, PO, once, PRN pain-mild, drug form: tab
dose range: 200 to 400 mg, PO, once, PRN pain-mild, drug form: tab
TM Hepatitis B Immune Globulin IM (HbIG) (Module)
Liver Panel (Bilirubin Total, ALP, Alb, ALT, GGT)
HIV 1/2 Antibody and p24 Antigen BCCDC
HIV 1/2 Antibody and p24 Antigen PHC
Consider consultation with the Sexual Assault Service Team in your health authority regarding management and forensic options
Consider consultation with Gynecology, Psychiatry/Mental Health and community based organizations
Family Care Conference or Meeting Needed
End of Life, Code Blue, Death
Discharge Planning or Coordinate of Care
